title: Low Voltage Distribution Cabinet Fault Learning Notes
content:
2025-05-02 Study Notes.  
Video Source: Bilibili "Electrician Lao Chen".  
Topic: Analysis and Handling of Common Relay Faults in Low-Voltage Distribution Cabinets.  
Key Points: 1. Several causes of relay contact ablation and visual identification methods; 2. Standard procedure for measuring coil resistance to determine coil integrity; 3. Troubleshooting approaches for relay malfunctions (e.g., power interference, mechanical jamming, etc.).  
Objective: To systematically organize common equipment fault-handling methods for enhancing vocational skills in electrical work.
summarized_info: I have created a note documenting the learning content on the fault analysis of relays in low-voltage distribution cabinets, with the aim of enhancing my professional skills.

title: Post-Delivery Notes for Power Distribution Cabinet Customers
content:
On December 5th, the final delivery of the power distribution cabinet for Mr. Li was completed. The following key points were demonstrated to the client, who expressed understanding and satisfaction:  
1. **Operation Process Demonstration**: Sequentially demonstrated startup, shutdown, checking load readings, and switching to backup circuits.  
2. **Safety Precautions Demonstration**: Emphasized that non-professionals should not open the cabinet door, highlighted the location and usage of the emergency power-off button, and outlined daily inspection points (abnormal noises, overheating, indicator light status).  
3. **Key Manual Guidance**: Explained how to read the wiring diagrams and navigate the self-troubleshooting index table.  
The client showed a high level of approval, raised no additional questions afterward, and the project was successfully closed.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang documented a summary note after delivering a distribution cabinet to a client, mentioning several key content sections demonstrated to the client.

title: Overtime Record from Yesterday

The two of us worked together to replace the old air switch and reinforced the main circuit. The issue was resolved, and the client was satisfied, paying overtime fees accordingly.

title: Technical Issue Response Memo
content:
During a work break in the morning, I responded to an inquiry from a colleague in Guangdong on the 'Electrician's Home' platform. The colleague asked about technical issues related to contactors. I provided a detailed explanation covering the following points:  
1. First and foremost, it is essential to match the coil voltage, as this is a prerequisite for safe operation.  
2. Select the appropriate auxiliary contacts based on the requirements of the control circuit, ensuring clarity on whether normally open or normally closed contacts are needed for the logic.  
3. Emphasize the importance of manually testing whether the contact actions are in place after installation.  
I’ve organized these points for future reference.
summarized_info: I have documented the key points of my response to a technical inquiry from a colleague in Guangdong, covering the selection logic for contactor coil voltage and auxiliary contacts.

title: Rehabilitation Record 0220
content: After lunch, I had a phone call with my father and consulted him about rehabilitation-related issues. My father shared some practical tips: 1. Given the nature of the work involving prolonged standing and bending, you can keep an elastic band in your toolbox and use the intervals during equipment maintenance to do a few sets of stretches in a safe area. 2. Focus on relaxing the lower back and hips. He demonstrated a few simple movements, such as using a sturdy workbench for lateral stretching and twisting of the waist. 3. He emphasized that the key is to utilize fragmented time at the worksite—just a few minutes each time, repeated multiple times—which is more suitable for the rhythm of us electricians than a single, prolonged workout. I’ve already noted it down on my phone and will start trying to incorporate it into my workflow tomorrow.

title: Technical Points During Business Trips
content: The master pointed out: 1. The coordination of microcomputer relay protection settings must consider the coordination coefficients between upper and lower levels and changes in system operation modes; 2. For the equivalent calculation of complex grounding grids, it is advisable to first simplify by zoning, and then account for mutual resistance effects. This should be combined with on-site re-measurement of soil resistivity.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang recorded the technical points regarding relay protection settings and grounding grid calculations that he obtained after consulting his master.

title: Notes on Making Swallow Kites
content:
Sand Swallow Kite Making Record:
1. Materials: Bamboo strips, silk paper, pigments, thread, tail tassels.
2. Process: The bamboo frame took about a week to shape through heating and bending (using spare time in the evenings). Covering, painting, and pasting took another week or so. The pattern design was inspired by traditional motifs, and adjusting the balance of the tail tassels took a few days.
3. Total Time: Nearly a month, completed using spare time after work.
4. Key Points: Symmetry of the frame is crucial; patience is required when heating and controlling the curvature. The silk paper covering must be stretched tightly, and pigments need multiple layers for a rich, vibrant appearance.
5. Plan: Completed. Showcased and explained the key making points to family on the evening of August 1st.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang documented the detailed process of making a swallow kite, which took nearly a month, and mentioned that he had already shown and explained it to his family.

title: Initial Draft of a Zero-Line Fault Case Study Article
content: 【Core Approach】Conduct a systematic review of three typical distribution cabinet tripping cases handled last month, particularly the challenging issue where equipment malfunction occurred due to a loose neutral wire connection without triggering protective actions. The focus is not only on documenting the phenomena and solutions but also on developing a clear troubleshooting logic flowchart. The goal is to help peers encountering similar problems avoid detours and quickly pinpoint the issue. Knowledge gains value only through circulation and sharing. Posting anonymously on the forum is also intended to gather genuine feedback and assess whether the summary is sufficiently clear and practical.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang recorded the core ideas for drafting a technical article in his notes, emphasizing the systematic review of cases and the organization of troubleshooting logic. He expressed the hope that the article would help peers avoid detours and promote the flow and sharing of knowledge, with plans to publish it anonymously to gather feedback from colleagues.

title: Workplace Learning Record 3.14
content: During a break in the morning while working at the meter room in Haisheng Garden, I studied the topic "Impact of Three-Phase Imbalance on Line Loss" through the ZhiDian APP. I focused on noting down the key formula: ΔP = 3I²R + (Ia² + Ib² + Ic² - 3I²)R, where I represents the average current. I understood that in actual installations, uneven load distribution directly leads to additional line loss. This theory holds guiding significance for on-site wiring planning and later-stage electricity usage analysis. I need to reflect further on this in combination with the circuit operated by Zhao Qiang this morning.
summarized_info: Recorded insights and formulas on learning circuit theory (three-phase imbalance and line loss) through a mobile app during work breaks, and connected them to practical work.

title: Forum Reply Draft and Reflections

Sharing experiences anonymously isn’t for any personal gain; it’s just that I feel my knowledge can help fellow professionals, especially by guiding the younger generation. That feeling is stronger than anything else. Seeing my insights spark discussions and even debates shows that I still hold some value in this field. Today, Engineer Chen came over to take a look and praised me for "delving deep into the subject," which really made my day.

Two incidents in Longhua District: water ingress into cable trenches in old residential areas; a transformer in the commercial area of Guomao Avenue overloaded and burned out under continuous high-humidity conditions, with replacement completed on the evening of the 15th. 3. Streetlight failures in Meilan District on a rainy night. Dampness was one of the main causes of equipment failures this month.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang summarized in his notes the multiple emergency repairs caused by the damp and rainy weather in April, listing the types of faults and the areas where they occurred, including the transformer overload emergency repair in the commercial district of Longhua District.

title: Grounding System Test Record
content:
**Location:** Construction area outside Sanya Phoenix Island Hotel  
**Time:** Morning, March 19, 2025  
**Test Item:** Resistance value of the modified grounding system  
**Test Results:** Zone A: 0.8Ω, Zone B: 1.1Ω, both meet the design standard (≤1.2Ω).  
**Issue Record:** During the morning inspection, it was found that the weld between grounding electrode No. 3 and the horizontal connecting flat steel was insufficient, indicating a potential for a weak weld. The construction team (led by Chen Jianguo) was immediately instructed to clean the area with an angle grinder, re-weld, and reinforce the anti-corrosion coating. The re-inspection after rectification was satisfactory.  
**Follow-up:** The test report has been archived, and the grounding system modification project for the power distribution room is completed.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang recorded the results of the grounding system resistance test conducted that morning (which met the standards), and provided a detailed account of the welding quality issues discovered on-site, along with the process of requiring the construction team to rectify the problems and conduct a re-inspection.

title: Load Adjustment and Testing Work Memo
content: March 19, 2025, conducted a power distribution load adjustment for the Phoenix Island Hotel with Jianguo. Main operations: 1. Operated circuit breakers for circuit switching (paying attention to the sequence). 2. Monitored and recorded the current data of phases A, B, and C in real-time (taking photos with a mobile phone). 3. Made slight adjustments to the distribution plan for the banquet hall and kitchen circuits based on the measured data; the load on Kitchen Circuit No. 2 was relatively high, so part of it was transferred to the backup circuit. 4. After completing the adjustments, conducted a half-hour load test, and the data remained stable. The key tasks involved reading the ammeter, manually adjusting switches, performing on-site calculations, and reviewing the results tomorrow morning.
summarized_info: The daily load adjustment workflow was documented, including on-site practical operations such as operating circuit breakers, monitoring and recording current data, fine-tuning plans based on actual measurements, and conducting load tests.

title: Preparation for Senior Technician - Summary of Learning Methods
content:
September Study Strategy:  
1. Review key theoretical points during work breaks in the daytime.  
2. Focus on tackling difficult sections of the textbook and organizing mistakes in the evening.  
3. A crucial step: I have applied to Squad Leader Zhang for permission to use the training room equipment for hands-on practice. For content like relay protection, merely reading books and watching videos is far from sufficient. It is essential to operate test instruments firsthand, correlating diagrams and parameter settings with actual equipment to develop muscle memory and handle fault diagnosis questions in exams. This is the true integration of "work" and "study." Awaiting Squad Leader Zhang's response.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang summarized the review strategy for September in his notes, emphasizing a learning approach that combines practical work experience (hands-on exercises) with theoretical review, and recorded that he had applied to use company equipment for exam preparation.

title: B Zone Corridor Bridge Conflict Resolution Plan
content:
Site Survey: Cable tray width 600mm, pipe diameter 300mm, vertical clearance at intersection less than 50mm.  
Temporary Solution: Reroute the cable tray to avoid the main pipe path, increasing the route by 2.5 meters. Four additional suspension reinforcement points (using M10 expansion bolts) are required at the middle and both ends of the rerouted section.  
Feasibility of the solution has been confirmed via phone with Engineer Li, who agreed to proceed.  
Material Requirements: 3 meters of 600mm wide cable tray, 2 horizontal 90-degree elbows, 4 sets of M10 suspension rods with matching nuts and washers.  
Follow-up: Supervise Xiao Chen's team to implement accordingly, focusing on checking the load-bearing capacity of reinforcement points.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang documented the on-site measurement data of conflicts between corridor bridge frames and pipelines in Zone B, the detour reinforcement plan, communication confirmations with designers, and subsequent supervision points.

title: Simulation Review of Secondary Circuit Wiring for High-Voltage Cabinets
content: On September 17, 2025, during a work break, I simulated a high-voltage cabinet secondary circuit wiring project using simple tools I carried with me at the property management office of a residential community on Haidian Island. The focus was on practicing muscle memory for standard procedures and logical deduction for troubleshooting. Attention must be paid to the connections and safety points in each step, including power outage, electrical testing, disassembly, installation, and testing. Three types of faults were simulated: 1. Poor contact of the fuse; 2. Oxidation of the relay auxiliary contacts; 3. Loose wiring terminals. Tomorrow, I need to review the relevant electrical schematic diagrams in the textbook for reinforcement.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang noted in his journal that he had used simple tools during work breaks the previous day to simulate the high-voltage cabinet wiring assessment project and summarized key points for troubleshooting.

title: Tree Crown Project High-Voltage Cabinet Final Testing Record
content: 2025-03-20. 1. Insulation Test: The insulation resistance of the main busbar to ground is >500MΩ, meeting the requirements; the insulation resistance of all branch circuits is >100MΩ. 2. Secondary Circuit Verification: All terminal block screws have been re-tightened, and the circuit numbers have been verified against the drawings without discrepancies. 3. Functional Test: The circuit breaker's opening and closing operations, indicator lights, and signal relay functions are all normal. 4. Complete the construction record form (No.: SG-0320-15) and attach the test data.

**Weaknesses and Risks:**

title: Specific Calculation of Financial Stress Testing
content: The stress test calculation was completed with Lijuan's assistance. Premise: Assuming my income drops to zero, relying solely on savings to cover rigid monthly household expenses (mortgage, car loan, tuition, basic living expenses, etc.) of approximately 11,500 yuan. Test 1: Direct calculation, 85,000 yuan in savings ÷ 11,500 yuan monthly expenses ≈ 7.4 months. Test 2: Considering the goal of "doubling the emergency fund" must be achieved within the next year, requiring a mandatory monthly savings of about 7,000 yuan, the maximum net monthly depletion of savings would be 11,500 yuan + 7,000 yuan = 18,500 yuan. Under this aggressive savings target, the 85,000 yuan in savings can only sustain about 4.6 months. Conclusion: The household's financial situation is fragile, and its ability to withstand risks is indeed insufficient. Postponing entrepreneurship is absolutely the right decision.
summarized_info: The stress test calculation process and conclusions based on savings and monthly expenses were recorded, showing different durations of support.

title: Selection Memo for Jianguo Hardware Store
content:
Today, I had a tea chat with Jianguo and provided suggestions regarding the addition of electrical tools to his store's product line:
1. Tool Selection: Recommend the "SATA" 05107 model for voltage testers and "Deli" DL2905; for screwdriver sets, recommend the combination of "Great Wall Precision Tools" PR-102 (Phillips) and SL-106 (slotted); for pliers, recommend "Knipex" 02 01 06 needle-nose pliers and "Stanley" 84-109-6 wire cutters.
2. Initial Stock Quantity: Stock 5-10 units of each tool. For commonly used consumables such as insulating tape, wire connectors, and electrical wires, start with 20 rolls/packages each.
3. Key Reminder: All electrical tools must have 3C certification. This is the safety baseline and a key factor in gaining customer trust.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang documented the selection of electrical tools, inventory levels, and 3C certification recommendations for Chen Jianguo's hardware store.

title: Final Decision and Reflections on the Poaching Invitation
content:
After in-depth discussions with Lijuan and careful personal deliberation, I have decided to politely decline the invitation to join your team through this recruitment effort.  

Key considerations:  
1. While the short-term high salary and flexible work arrangements are appealing, the stability of the new environment is uncertain and could potentially disrupt the family's routine.  
2. My current work platform is stable and provides a favorable environment for technical growth, making it fertile ground for long-term development.  
3. My long-term goals are clear: to further deepen my professional skills on the existing foundation and devote myself fully to preparing for the Senior Technician certification. This holds greater long-term value than pursuing a one-time salary increase.  
4. Family consensus: Stability is the priority, and they support my focus on technical improvement and exam preparation.  

Taking all of the above into account, I have chosen to decline the offer. I will use this as motivation to focus even more intently on advancing my technical skills and preparing for the certification.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang documented the final decision to decline the job offer and the core reasons behind it, emphasizing family discussions, considerations of stability, and the long-term plan to deepen technical expertise in preparation for the senior technician certification.

title: Insurance Product Comparison Memo

Accident medical coverage amounts (50,000 / 100,000 / 80,000); 2. Hospitalization allowances (100/day, 150/day, none); 3. Coverage scope for specific occupational risks ('Anxin Bao' explicitly includes acute injuries caused by high-altitude work or prolonged bending). title: Maintenance Inspection Record - Chandelier
content: Inspection Subject: Old-fashioned chandelier in Uncle Wang's living room. Issues Found: 1. Signs of loose wiring terminals inside the lamp holder, leading to increased contact resistance; 2. Oxidation and blackening of the wall switch contacts, causing poor contact. These two issues together result in flickering lights and slight abnormal noises. Actions Taken: After cutting off the power, the wiring terminals were tightened, and the switch contacts were polished with fine sandpaper. The flickering has been temporarily eliminated. Recommendation: For safety reasons, it is recommended to replace the old-fashioned chandelier with an LED ceiling light, and an offer was made to assist with the installation.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang documented the specific issues discovered while helping a neighbor inspect the chandelier (loose wiring terminals, oxidized switch contacts), the actions taken (tightening, polishing), and the recommendations (replacing the LED light and assisting with installation).

title: Maintenance Inspection Record - Chandelier Re-inspection
content: Second visit to check Uncle Wang's ceiling light. After the last fix, it started flickering again after two days. This time, I removed the lampshade for a thorough inspection and found that the metal spring in the lamp socket had slightly deformed due to prolonged heat exposure, causing poor contact with the bulb. I carefully adjusted the angle of the spring with tools, temporarily restoring the lighting. Once again, I recommended switching to an LED ceiling light for better safety and energy efficiency. Uncle Wang was very grateful and insisted on giving me money, but I smiled and declined. Helping out neighbors with small tasks like this is nothing.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang documented the second inspection of the neighbor Uncle Wang's chandelier, identifying a deformed lamp socket reed and performing temporary reinforcement. He once again recommended replacing it with an LED light and politely declined any reward.

title: Balcony Solitude Reflection Notes
content: The children are asleep, and I'm quietly reflecting on the balcony. The job offer from that new studio in the same industry I received today is indeed tempting—it would mean a significant short-term income boost. But thinking calmly, the discussion I had earlier at home with Lijuan (my wife) was right. My biggest advantage at the moment lies in the technical experience and stable platform I've accumulated at the company, and the preparation for the senior technician certification is at a critical stage. Switching to a new environment would inevitably bring adaptation and work-related pressures in the initial phase, which might actually hinder my exam preparation and deep technical accumulation. In the long run, the growth opportunities provided by my current platform are more certain. Conclusion: At this stage, I should focus more on deepening my technical skills and relying on the existing stable platform to prepare for the senior technician certification, rather than pursuing short-term high salaries. I'll formally decline the offer tomorrow.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang was alone on the balcony, recording his thoughts on whether to accept the job offer from a competitor. He reflected on his discussion with his wife and reached the final conclusion: "Focus on deepening technical skills, rely on the current platform to prepare for the advanced technician certification, rather than pursuing short-term high salaries." He decided to politely decline the invitation.

title: Thoughts on Guiding Zihan to Establish Study Habits
content: Zihan has just started elementary school and needs to establish habits for previewing and reviewing lessons. 1) Preview method: Guide him to first look at the title and illustrations of the text, ask a few questions on his own, and then read the text with those questions in mind. For math preview, start by looking at example problems and try to understand the steps. 2) Review method: After school, without opening the book, have him recall what he learned that day (such as Chinese characters or math formulas) and explain it to me. Then, open the book to check for any gaps or missing points. Use the metaphor of "first exploring for treasure, then searching for treasure" to make it fun for him. This approach has already been implemented on a trial basis and requires daily reminders.
summarized_info: The specific methods for guiding my younger son, Zihan, to establish habits of previewing and reviewing are documented. These include asking questions based on titles during preview and recalling before reviewing the material, with the use of analogies.

title: Entrepreneurship Consultation Record - Boss Li
content:
On the evening of April 28, 2025, I inquired with Boss Li about opening an electrical appliance repair shop under the pretext of helping a friend. Key information recorded:  
1. Startup capital: Approximately 100,000+ RMB, depending on scale and location.  
2. Monthly costs: Rent (4,000–5,000 RMB), utilities (a few hundred RMB), spare parts inventory (variable).  
3. Main challenges: Acquiring initial customers (requires ground promotion/online marketing), continuous technical learning, and accounts receivable cycles.  
4. Customer retention: Transparent pricing, after-sales follow-up, and personal care.  
Summary: Physical store operations rely heavily on ground promotion and word-of-mouth reputation, as well as cash flow management. Boss Li’s experience is practical and worth referencing.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang recorded the key points of consulting with Boss Li regarding the operational costs, challenges, and customer retention methods for opening an electrical appliance repair shop.

title: Micro-lesson Study Notes 0214
content: Today I studied a free micro-lesson on the topic of fault diagnosis for new intelligent circuit breakers. Key takeaways: 1. Common fault symptoms: abnormal tripping, indicator lights not turning on, inability to close the circuit. 2. Troubleshooting steps: first cut off power, measure voltage, check modules, review settings. 3. Key measurement points: main circuit voltage, control circuit continuity, protection module signals. 4. Safety precautions: always verify power is off, double-check. This knowledge is helpful for troubleshooting last time's site fault and exam preparation. I'll reorganize my thoughts using the new methods.
summarized_info: Lu Mingqiang documented the key knowledge points and reflections learned from an online micro-lesson on fault diagnosis of smart circuit breakers.

Allocate funds for specific purposes, such as education and medical expenses, through separate planning. title: Insurance Consultation Memorandum
content: On June 8th, consulted Li Wei about insurance matters. Critical illness insurance: pays out upon diagnosis, used for income compensation and medical expenses, with an annual premium of several thousand yuan. Accident insurance: provides compensation for death/disability caused by accidents, covers medical expenses, with a relatively low annual premium. The two types of insurance complement each other; selection should be based on family budget and risk tolerance.
summarized_info: Recorded the key points of consultation with Li Wei regarding the differences and costs between critical illness insurance and accident insurance.

title: Personal Planning and Recent Decisions
content: Regarding the consideration of whether to open a repair workshop, I have been thinking about this matter recently. I have carefully assessed our family savings, my technical qualifications, and my physical condition (my back injury is still in the recovery phase). Conclusion: temporarily put it on hold. There is a significant gap in startup funds, and if things don’t go well from the start, our family’s ability to withstand risks is too weak. Although my current job is demanding, the income is stable. For now, the more important thing is to focus on obtaining the senior technician certification, solidifying my technical foundation, and gradually saving money. I need to take care of my family first, get the certification, and look for opportunities later. This decision gives me peace of mind.

The reasons include a significant shortfall in startup capital, weak family resilience to risks, and the stability of his current job. He has shifted his focus to obtaining an advanced technician certificate and saving money to support his family.
